page.title: 17The School Catchment
page.content: There are many areas from which the Plume School pupils come.For example: Goldhanger,Heybridge,Great Totham, Wickham Bishops,Ulting,Woodham Walter, Purleigh,Hazeleigh,Latchingdon and Mundon.Because some pupils live more than three miles away from the school they are entitled to free school transport.The Council gives them a bus ticket each year.The school bus system works thus:the buses go to certain stops where we all get on.First it goes to Upper School(third to sixth years) then to Lower School(first and second years) In the evening some of the buses go to Upper School first,and some to Lower School.We have columns in the playground and we queue up there.When a teacher calls our area another teacher shows us to our bus. BY HELEN CARLILE 1B2
